         <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
            <header class="preface-titlepage">
               <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
            </header>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">DUNCAN, king of Scotland.</span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">MALCOLM</span>
                        <span class="personname">DONALBAIN</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">his sons.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">MACBETH</span>
                        <span class="personname">BANQUO</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">generals of the king's army.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">MACDUFF</span>
                        <span class="personname">LENNOX</span>
                        <span class="personname">ROSS</span>
                        <span class="personname">MENTEITH</span>
                        <span class="personname">ANGUS</span>
                        <span class="personname">CAITHNESS</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">noblemen of Scotland.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">FLEANCE, son to Banquo.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">SIWARD, Earl of Northumberland, general of the English forces.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">YOUNG SIWARD, his son.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">SEYTON, an officer attending on Macbeth.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Boy, son to Macduff. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">An English Doctor. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Scotch Doctor. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Soldier.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Porter.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">An Old Man.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LADY MACBETH</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LADY MACDUFF</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Gentlewoman attending on Lady Macbeth. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">HECATE</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Three Witches.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Apparitions.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Lords, Gentlemen, Officers, Soldiers, Murderers, Attendants, and Messengers. </span>
            </p>
            <p>SCENE  Scotland: England.</p>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  A desert place.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  A camp near Forres.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.4">3. SCENE III.  A heath near Forres.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.5">4. SCENE IV.  Forres. The palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.6">5. SCENE V.  Inverness. Macbeth's castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.7">6. SCENE VI.  Before Macbeth's castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.8">7. SCENE VII.  Macbeth's castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  A desert place.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Thunder and lightning. Enter three Witches</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">When shall we three meet again</div>
                     <div class="line">In thunder, lightning, or in rain?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">When the hurlyburly's done,</div>
                     <div class="line">When the battle's lost and won.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">That will be ere the set of sun.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">Where the place?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the heath.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">There to meet with Macbeth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">I come, Graymalkin!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">Paddock calls.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">Anon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                     <div class="line">Fair is foul, and foul is fair:</div>
                     <div class="line">Hover through the fog and filthy air.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  A camp near Forres.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Alarum within. Enter DUNCAN, MALCOLM, DONALBAIN,
LENNOX, with Attendants, meeting a bleeding Sergeant</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUNCAN</div>
                     <div class="line">What bloody man is that? He can report,</div>
                     <div class="line">As seemeth by his plight, of the revolt</div>
                     <div class="line">The newest state.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALCOLM</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the sergeant</div>
                     <div class="line">Who like a good and hardy soldier fought</div>
                     <div class="line">'Gainst my captivity. Hail, brave friend!</div>
                     <div class="line">Say to the king the knowledge of the broil</div>
                     <div class="line">As thou didst leave it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Sergeant</div>
                     <div class="line">Doubtful it stood;</div>
                     <div class="line">As two spent swimmers, that do cling together</div>
                     <div class="line">And choke their art. The merciless Macdonwald--</div>
                     <div class="line">Worthy to be a rebel, for to that</div>
                     <div class="line">The multiplying villanies of nature</div>
                     <div class="line">Do swarm upon him--from the western isles</div>
                     <div class="line">Of kerns and gallowglasses is supplied;</div>
                     <div class="line">And fortune, on his damned quarrel smiling,</div>
                     <div class="line">Show'd like a rebel's whore: but all's too weak:</div>
                     <div class="line">For brave Macbeth--well he deserves that name--</div>
                     <div class="line">Disdaining fortune, with his brandish'd steel,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which smoked with bloody execution,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like valour's minion carved out his passage</div>
                     <div class="line">Till he faced the slave;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which ne'er shook hands, nor bade farewell to him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till he unseam'd him from the nave to the chaps,</div>
                     <div class="line">And fix'd his head upon our battlements.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUNCAN</div>
                     <div class="line">O valiant cousin! worthy gentleman!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Sergeant</div>
                     <div class="line">As whence the sun 'gins his reflection</div>
                     <div class="line">Shipwrecking storms and direful thunders break,</div>
                     <div class="line">So from that spring whence comfort seem'd to come</div>
                     <div class="line">Discomfort swells. Mark, king of Scotland, mark:</div>
                     <div class="line">No sooner justice had with valour arm'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Compell'd these skipping kerns to trust their heels,</div>
                     <div class="line">But the Norweyan lord surveying vantage,</div>
                     <div class="line">With furbish'd arms and new supplies of men</div>
                     <div class="line">Began a fresh assault.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUNCAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Dismay'd not this</div>
                     <div class="line">Our captains, Macbeth and Banquo?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Sergeant</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes;</div>
                     <div class="line">As sparrows eagles, or the hare the lion.</div>
                     <div class="line">If I say sooth, I must report they were</div>
                     <div class="line">As cannons overcharged with double cracks, so they</div>
                     <div class="line">Doubly redoubled strokes upon the foe:</div>
                     <div class="line">Except they meant to bathe in reeking wounds,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or memorise another Golgotha,</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot tell.</div>
                     <div class="line">But I am faint, my gashes cry for help.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUNCAN</div>
                     <div class="line">So well thy words become thee as thy wounds;</div>
                     <div class="line">They smack of honour both. Go get him surgeons.</div>
                     <p>Exit Sergeant, attended</p>
                     <div class="line">Who comes here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ROSS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALCOLM</div>
                     <div class="line">The worthy thane of Ross.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LENNOX</div>
                     <div class="line">What a haste looks through his eyes! So should he look</div>
                     <div class="line">That seems to speak things strange.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSS</div>
                     <div class="line">God save the king!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUNCAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Whence camest thou, worthy thane?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSS</div>
                     <div class="line">From Fife, great king;</div>
                     <div class="line">Where the Norweyan banners flout the sky</div>
                     <div class="line">And fan our people cold. Norway himself,</div>
                     <div class="line">With terrible numbers,</div>
                     <div class="line">Assisted by that most disloyal traitor</div>
                     <div class="line">The thane of Cawdor, began a dismal conflict;</div>
                     <div class="line">Till that Bellona's bridegroom, lapp'd in proof,</div>
                     <div class="line">Confronted him with self-comparisons,</div>
                     <div class="line">Point against point rebellious, arm 'gainst arm.</div>
                     <div class="line">Curbing his lavish spirit: and, to conclude,</div>
                     <div class="line">The victory fell on us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUNCAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Great happiness!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSS</div>
                     <div class="line">That now</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweno, the Norways' king, craves composition:</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor would we deign him burial of his men</div>
                     <div class="line">Till he disbursed at Saint Colme's inch</div>
                     <div class="line">Ten thousand dollars to our general use.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUNCAN</div>
                     <div class="line">No more that thane of Cawdor shall deceive</div>
                     <div class="line">Our bosom interest: go pronounce his present death,</div>
                     <div class="line">And with his former title greet Macbeth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSS</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll see it done.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUNCAN</div>
                     <div class="line">What he hath lost noble Macbeth hath won.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  A heath near Forres.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Thunder. Enter the three Witches</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">Where hast thou been, sister?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">Killing swine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">Sister, where thou?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">A sailor's wife had chestnuts in her lap,</div>
                     <div class="line">And munch'd, and munch'd, and munch'd:--</div>
                     <div class="line">'Give me,' quoth I:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Aroint thee, witch!' the rump-fed ronyon cries.</div>
                     <div class="line">Her husband's to Aleppo gone, master o' the Tiger:</div>
                     <div class="line">But in a sieve I'll thither sail,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, like a rat without a tail,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll do, I'll do, and I'll do.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll give thee a wind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou'rt kind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">And I another.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">I myself have all the other,</div>
                     <div class="line">And the very ports they blow,</div>
                     <div class="line">All the quarters that they know</div>
                     <div class="line">I' the shipman's card.</div>
                     <div class="line">I will drain him dry as hay:</div>
                     <div class="line">Sleep shall neither night nor day</div>
                     <div class="line">Hang upon his pent-house lid;</div>
                     <div class="line">He shall live a man forbid:</div>
                     <div class="line">Weary se'nnights nine times nine</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall he dwindle, peak and pine:</div>
                     <div class="line">Though his bark cannot be lost,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet it shall be tempest-tost.</div>
                     <div class="line">Look what I have.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">Show me, show me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">Here I have a pilot's thumb,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wreck'd as homeward he did come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Drum within</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">A drum, a drum!</div>
                     <div class="line">Macbeth doth come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                     <div class="line">The weird sisters, hand in hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">Posters of the sea and land,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus do go about, about:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thrice to thine and thrice to mine</div>
                     <div class="line">And thrice again, to make up nine.</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace! the charm's wound up.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter MACBETH and BANQUO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">So foul and fair a day I have not seen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BANQUO</div>
                     <div class="line">How far is't call'd to Forres? What are these</div>
                     <div class="line">So wither'd and so wild in their attire,</div>
                     <div class="line">That look not like the inhabitants o' the earth,</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet are on't? Live you? or are you aught</div>
                     <div class="line">That man may question? You seem to understand me,</div>
                     <div class="line">By each at once her chappy finger laying</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon her skinny lips: you should be women,</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet your beards forbid me to interpret</div>
                     <div class="line">That you are so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak, if you can: what are you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">All hail, Macbeth! hail to thee, thane of Glamis!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">All hail, Macbeth, hail to thee, thane of Cawdor!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">All hail, Macbeth, thou shalt be king hereafter!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BANQUO</div>
                     <div class="line">Good sir, why do you start; and seem to fear</div>
                     <div class="line">Things that do sound so fair? I' the name of truth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Are ye fantastical, or that indeed</div>
                     <div class="line">Which outwardly ye show? My noble partner</div>
                     <div class="line">You greet with present grace and great prediction</div>
                     <div class="line">Of noble having and of royal hope,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he seems rapt withal: to me you speak not.</div>
                     <div class="line">If you can look into the seeds of time,</div>
                     <div class="line">And say which grain will grow and which will not,</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak then to me, who neither beg nor fear</div>
                     <div class="line">Your favours nor your hate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">Hail!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">Hail!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">Hail!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">Lesser than Macbeth, and greater.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">Not so happy, yet much happier.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Third Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shalt get kings, though thou be none:</div>
                     <div class="line">So all hail, Macbeth and Banquo!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Witch</div>
                     <div class="line">Banquo and Macbeth, all hail!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay, you imperfect speakers, tell me more:</div>
                     <div class="line">By Sinel's death I know I am thane of Glamis;</div>
                     <div class="line">But how of Cawdor? the thane of Cawdor lives,</div>
                     <div class="line">A prosperous gentleman; and to be king</div>
                     <div class="line">Stands not within the prospect of belief,</div>
                     <div class="line">No more than to be Cawdor. Say from whence</div>
                     <div class="line">You owe this strange intelligence? or why</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon this blasted heath you stop our way</div>
                     <div class="line">With such prophetic greeting? Speak, I charge you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Witches vanish</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BANQUO</div>
                     <div class="line">The earth hath bubbles, as the water has,</div>
                     <div class="line">And these are of them. Whither are they vanish'd?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">Into the air; and what seem'd corporal melted</div>
                     <div class="line">As breath into the wind. Would they had stay'd!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BANQUO</div>
                     <div class="line">Were such things here as we do speak about?</div>
                     <div class="line">Or have we eaten on the insane root</div>
                     <div class="line">That takes the reason prisoner?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">Your children shall be kings.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BANQUO</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall be king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">And thane of Cawdor too: went it not so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BANQUO</div>
                     <div class="line">To the selfsame tune and words. Who's here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ROSS and ANGUS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSS</div>
                     <div class="line">The king hath happily received, Macbeth,</div>
                     <div class="line">The news of thy success; and when he reads</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy personal venture in the rebels' fight,</div>
                     <div class="line">His wonders and his praises do contend</div>
                     <div class="line">Which should be thine or his: silenced with that,</div>
                     <div class="line">In viewing o'er the rest o' the selfsame day,</div>
                     <div class="line">He finds thee in the stout Norweyan ranks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing afeard of what thyself didst make,</div>
                     <div class="line">Strange images of death. As thick as hail</div>
                     <div class="line">Came post with post; and every one did bear</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy praises in his kingdom's great defence,</div>
                     <div class="line">And pour'd them down before him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGUS</div>
                     <div class="line">We are sent</div>
                     <div class="line">To give thee from our royal master thanks;</div>
                     <div class="line">Only to herald thee into his sight,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not pay thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSS</div>
                     <div class="line">And, for an earnest of a greater honour,</div>
                     <div class="line">He bade me, from him, call thee thane of Cawdor:</div>
                     <div class="line">In which addition, hail, most worthy thane!</div>
                     <div class="line">For it is thine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BANQUO</div>
                     <div class="line">What, can the devil speak true?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">The thane of Cawdor lives: why do you dress me</div>
                     <div class="line">In borrow'd robes?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Who was the thane lives yet;</div>
                     <div class="line">But under heavy judgment bears that life</div>
                     <div class="line">Which he deserves to lose. Whether he was combined</div>
                     <div class="line">With those of Norway, or did line the rebel</div>
                     <div class="line">With hidden help and vantage, or that with both</div>
                     <div class="line">He labour'd in his country's wreck, I know not;</div>
                     <div class="line">But treasons capital, confess'd and proved,</div>
                     <div class="line">Have overthrown him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Glamis, and thane of Cawdor!</div>
                     <div class="line">The greatest is behind.</div>
                     <p>To ROSS and ANGUS</p>
                     <div class="line">Thanks for your pains.</div>
                     <p>To BANQUO</p>
                     <div class="line">Do you not hope your children shall be kings,</div>
                     <div class="line">When those that gave the thane of Cawdor to me</div>
                     <div class="line">Promised no less to them?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BANQUO</div>
                     <div class="line">That trusted home</div>
                     <div class="line">Might yet enkindle you unto the crown,</div>
                     <div class="line">Besides the thane of Cawdor. But 'tis strange:</div>
                     <div class="line">And oftentimes, to win us to our harm,</div>
                     <div class="line">The instruments of darkness tell us truths,</div>
                     <div class="line">Win us with honest trifles, to betray's</div>
                     <div class="line">In deepest consequence.</div>
                     <div class="line">Cousins, a word, I pray you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span> Two truths are told,</div>
                     <div class="line">As happy prologues to the swelling act</div>
                     <div class="line">Of the imperial theme.--I thank you, gentlemen.</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  This supernatural soliciting</div>
                     <div class="line">Cannot be ill, cannot be good: if ill,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why hath it given me earnest of success,</div>
                     <div class="line">Commencing in a truth? I am thane of Cawdor:</div>
                     <div class="line">If good, why do I yield to that suggestion</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose horrid image doth unfix my hair</div>
                     <div class="line">And make my seated heart knock at my ribs,</div>
                     <div class="line">Against the use of nature? Present fears</div>
                     <div class="line">Are less than horrible imaginings:</div>
                     <div class="line">My thought, whose murder yet is but fantastical,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shakes so my single state of man that function</div>
                     <div class="line">Is smother'd in surmise, and nothing is</div>
                     <div class="line">But what is not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BANQUO</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, how our partner's rapt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  If chance will have me king, why, chance may crown me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Without my stir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BANQUO</div>
                     <div class="line">New horrors come upon him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like our strange garments, cleave not to their mould</div>
                     <div class="line">But with the aid of use.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>                Come what come may,</div>
                     <div class="line">Time and the hour runs through the roughest day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BANQUO</div>
                     <div class="line">Worthy Macbeth, we stay upon your leisure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me your favour: my dull brain was wrought</div>
                     <div class="line">With things forgotten. Kind gentlemen, your pains</div>
                     <div class="line">Are register'd where every day I turn</div>
                     <div class="line">The leaf to read them. Let us toward the king.</div>
                     <div class="line">Think upon what hath chanced, and, at more time,</div>
                     <div class="line">The interim having weigh'd it, let us speak</div>
                     <div class="line">Our free hearts each to other.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BANQUO</div>
                     <div class="line">Very gladly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">Till then, enough. Come, friends.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Forres. The palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Flourish. Enter DUNCAN, MALCOLM, DONALBAIN, LENNOX,
and Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUNCAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Is execution done on Cawdor? Are not</div>
                     <div class="line">Those in commission yet return'd?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MALCOLM</div>
                     <div class="line">My liege,</div>
                     <div class="line">They are not yet come back. But I have spoke</div>
                     <div class="line">With one that saw him die: who did report</div>
                     <div class="line">That very frankly he confess'd his treasons,</div>
                     <div class="line">Implored your highness' pardon and set forth</div>
                     <div class="line">A deep repentance: nothing in his life</div>
                     <div class="line">Became him like the leaving it; he died</div>
                     <div class="line">As one that had been studied in his death</div>
                     <div class="line">To throw away the dearest thing he owed,</div>
                     <div class="line">As 'twere a careless trifle.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUNCAN</div>
                     <div class="line">There's no art</div>
                     <div class="line">To find the mind's construction in the face:</div>
                     <div class="line">He was a gentleman on whom I built</div>
                     <div class="line">An absolute trust.</div>
                     <p>Enter MACBETH, BANQUO, ROSS, and ANGUS</p>
                     <div class="line">O worthiest cousin!</div>
                     <div class="line">The sin of my ingratitude even now</div>
                     <div class="line">Was heavy on me: thou art so far before</div>
                     <div class="line">That swiftest wing of recompense is slow</div>
                     <div class="line">To overtake thee. Would thou hadst less deserved,</div>
                     <div class="line">That the proportion both of thanks and payment</div>
                     <div class="line">Might have been mine! only I have left to say,</div>
                     <div class="line">More is thy due than more than all can pay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">The service and the loyalty I owe,</div>
                     <div class="line">In doing it, pays itself. Your highness' part</div>
                     <div class="line">Is to receive our duties; and our duties</div>
                     <div class="line">Are to your throne and state children and servants,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which do but what they should, by doing every thing</div>
                     <div class="line">Safe toward your love and honour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUNCAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Welcome hither:</div>
                     <div class="line">I have begun to plant thee, and will labour</div>
                     <div class="line">To make thee full of growing. Noble Banquo,</div>
                     <div class="line">That hast no less deserved, nor must be known</div>
                     <div class="line">No less to have done so, let me enfold thee</div>
                     <div class="line">And hold thee to my heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BANQUO</div>
                     <div class="line">There if I grow,</div>
                     <div class="line">The harvest is your own.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUNCAN</div>
                     <div class="line">My plenteous joys,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wanton in fulness, seek to hide themselves</div>
                     <div class="line">In drops of sorrow. Sons, kinsmen, thanes,</div>
                     <div class="line">And you whose places are the nearest, know</div>
                     <div class="line">We will establish our estate upon</div>
                     <div class="line">Our eldest, Malcolm, whom we name hereafter</div>
                     <div class="line">The Prince of Cumberland; which honour must</div>
                     <div class="line">Not unaccompanied invest him only,</div>
                     <div class="line">But signs of nobleness, like stars, shall shine</div>
                     <div class="line">On all deservers. From hence to Inverness,</div>
                     <div class="line">And bind us further to you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">The rest is labour, which is not used for you:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll be myself the harbinger and make joyful</div>
                     <div class="line">The hearing of my wife with your approach;</div>
                     <div class="line">So humbly take my leave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUNCAN</div>
                     <div class="line">My worthy Cawdor!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  The Prince of Cumberland! that is a step</div>
                     <div class="line">On which I must fall down, or else o'erleap,</div>
                     <div class="line">For in my way it lies. Stars, hide your fires;</div>
                     <div class="line">Let not light see my black and deep desires:</div>
                     <div class="line">The eye wink at the hand; yet let that be,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which the eye fears, when it is done, to see.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUNCAN</div>
                     <div class="line">True, worthy Banquo; he is full so valiant,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in his commendations I am fed;</div>
                     <div class="line">It is a banquet to me. Let's after him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose care is gone before to bid us welcome:</div>
                     <div class="line">It is a peerless kinsman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Flourish. Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. SCENE V.  Inverness. Macbeth's castle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter LADY MACBETH, reading a letter</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">'They met me in the day of success: and I have</div>
                     <div class="line">learned by the perfectest report, they have more in</div>
                     <div class="line">them than mortal knowledge. When I burned in desire</div>
                     <div class="line">to question them further, they made themselves air,</div>
                     <div class="line">into which they vanished. Whiles I stood rapt in</div>
                     <div class="line">the wonder of it, came missives from the king, who</div>
                     <div class="line">all-hailed me 'Thane of Cawdor;' by which title,</div>
                     <div class="line">before, these weird sisters saluted me, and referred</div>
                     <div class="line">me to the coming on of time, with 'Hail, king that</div>
                     <div class="line">shalt be!' This have I thought good to deliver</div>
                     <div class="line">thee, my dearest partner of greatness, that thou</div>
                     <div class="line">mightst not lose the dues of rejoicing, by being</div>
                     <div class="line">ignorant of what greatness is promised thee. Lay it</div>
                     <div class="line">to thy heart, and farewell.'</div>
                     <div class="line">Glamis thou art, and Cawdor; and shalt be</div>
                     <div class="line">What thou art promised: yet do I fear thy nature;</div>
                     <div class="line">It is too full o' the milk of human kindness</div>
                     <div class="line">To catch the nearest way: thou wouldst be great;</div>
                     <div class="line">Art not without ambition, but without</div>
                     <div class="line">The illness should attend it: what thou wouldst highly,</div>
                     <div class="line">That wouldst thou holily; wouldst not play false,</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet wouldst wrongly win: thou'ldst have, great Glamis,</div>
                     <div class="line">That which cries 'Thus thou must do, if thou have it;</div>
                     <div class="line">And that which rather thou dost fear to do</div>
                     <div class="line">Than wishest should be undone.' Hie thee hither,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I may pour my spirits in thine ear;</div>
                     <div class="line">And chastise with the valour of my tongue</div>
                     <div class="line">All that impedes thee from the golden round,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which fate and metaphysical aid doth seem</div>
                     <div class="line">To have thee crown'd withal.</div>
                     <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
                     <div class="line">What is your tidings?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">The king comes here to-night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou'rt mad to say it:</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not thy master with him? who, were't so,</div>
                     <div class="line">Would have inform'd for preparation.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">So please you, it is true: our thane is coming:</div>
                     <div class="line">One of my fellows had the speed of him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, almost dead for breath, had scarcely more</div>
                     <div class="line">Than would make up his message.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">Give him tending;</div>
                     <div class="line">He brings great news.</div>
                     <p>Exit Messenger</p>
                     <div class="line">The raven himself is hoarse</div>
                     <div class="line">That croaks the fatal entrance of Duncan</div>
                     <div class="line">Under my battlements. Come, you spirits</div>
                     <div class="line">That tend on mortal thoughts, unsex me here,</div>
                     <div class="line">And fill me from the crown to the toe top-full</div>
                     <div class="line">Of direst cruelty! make thick my blood;</div>
                     <div class="line">Stop up the access and passage to remorse,</div>
                     <div class="line">That no compunctious visitings of nature</div>
                     <div class="line">Shake my fell purpose, nor keep peace between</div>
                     <div class="line">The effect and it! Come to my woman's breasts,</div>
                     <div class="line">And take my milk for gall, you murdering ministers,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherever in your sightless substances</div>
                     <div class="line">You wait on nature's mischief! Come, thick night,</div>
                     <div class="line">And pall thee in the dunnest smoke of hell,</div>
                     <div class="line">That my keen knife see not the wound it makes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor heaven peep through the blanket of the dark,</div>
                     <div class="line">To cry 'Hold, hold!'</div>
                     <p>Enter MACBETH</p>
                     <div class="line">Great Glamis! worthy Cawdor!</div>
                     <div class="line">Greater than both, by the all-hail hereafter!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy letters have transported me beyond</div>
                     <div class="line">This ignorant present, and I feel now</div>
                     <div class="line">The future in the instant.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">My dearest love,</div>
                     <div class="line">Duncan comes here to-night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">And when goes hence?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">To-morrow, as he purposes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">O, never</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall sun that morrow see!</div>
                     <div class="line">Your face, my thane, is as a book where men</div>
                     <div class="line">May read strange matters. To beguile the time,</div>
                     <div class="line">Look like the time; bear welcome in your eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your hand, your tongue: look like the innocent flower,</div>
                     <div class="line">But be the serpent under't. He that's coming</div>
                     <div class="line">Must be provided for: and you shall put</div>
                     <div class="line">This night's great business into my dispatch;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which shall to all our nights and days to come</div>
                     <div class="line">Give solely sovereign sway and masterdom.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">We will speak further.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">Only look up clear;</div>
                     <div class="line">To alter favour ever is to fear:</div>
                     <div class="line">Leave all the rest to me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.7">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>6. SCENE VI.  Before Macbeth's castle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Hautboys and torches. Enter DUNCAN, MALCOLM,
DONALBAIN, BANQUO, LENNOX, MACDUFF, ROSS, ANGUS,
and Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUNCAN</div>
                     <div class="line">This castle hath a pleasant seat; the air</div>
                     <div class="line">Nimbly and sweetly recommends itself</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto our gentle senses.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BANQUO</div>
                     <div class="line">This guest of summer,</div>
                     <div class="line">The temple-haunting martlet, does approve,</div>
                     <div class="line">By his loved mansionry, that the heaven's breath</div>
                     <div class="line">Smells wooingly here: no jutty, frieze,</div>
                     <div class="line">Buttress, nor coign of vantage, but this bird</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath made his pendent bed and procreant cradle:</div>
                     <div class="line">Where they most breed and haunt, I have observed,</div>
                     <div class="line">The air is delicate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter LADY MACBETH</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUNCAN</div>
                     <div class="line">See, see, our honour'd hostess!</div>
                     <div class="line">The love that follows us sometime is our trouble,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which still we thank as love. Herein I teach you</div>
                     <div class="line">How you shall bid God 'ild us for your pains,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thank us for your trouble.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">All our service</div>
                     <div class="line">In every point twice done and then done double</div>
                     <div class="line">Were poor and single business to contend</div>
                     <div class="line">Against those honours deep and broad wherewith</div>
                     <div class="line">Your majesty loads our house: for those of old,</div>
                     <div class="line">And the late dignities heap'd up to them,</div>
                     <div class="line">We rest your hermits.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUNCAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Where's the thane of Cawdor?</div>
                     <div class="line">We coursed him at the heels, and had a purpose</div>
                     <div class="line">To be his purveyor: but he rides well;</div>
                     <div class="line">And his great love, sharp as his spur, hath holp him</div>
                     <div class="line">To his home before us. Fair and noble hostess,</div>
                     <div class="line">We are your guest to-night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">Your servants ever</div>
                     <div class="line">Have theirs, themselves and what is theirs, in compt,</div>
                     <div class="line">To make their audit at your highness' pleasure,</div>
                     <div class="line">Still to return your own.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUNCAN</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me your hand;</div>
                     <div class="line">Conduct me to mine host: we love him highly,</div>
                     <div class="line">And shall continue our graces towards him.</div>
                     <div class="line">By your leave, hostess.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.8">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>7. SCENE VII.  Macbeth's castle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Hautboys and torches. Enter a Sewer, and divers
Servants with dishes and service, and pass over the
stage. Then enter MACBETH</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">If it were done when 'tis done, then 'twere well</div>
                     <div class="line">It were done quickly: if the assassination</div>
                     <div class="line">Could trammel up the consequence, and catch</div>
                     <div class="line">With his surcease success; that but this blow</div>
                     <div class="line">Might be the be-all and the end-all here,</div>
                     <div class="line">But here, upon this bank and shoal of time,</div>
                     <div class="line">We'ld jump the life to come. But in these cases</div>
                     <div class="line">We still have judgment here; that we but teach</div>
                     <div class="line">Bloody instructions, which, being taught, return</div>
                     <div class="line">To plague the inventor: this even-handed justice</div>
                     <div class="line">Commends the ingredients of our poison'd chalice</div>
                     <div class="line">To our own lips. He's here in double trust;</div>
                     <div class="line">First, as I am his kinsman and his subject,</div>
                     <div class="line">Strong both against the deed; then, as his host,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who should against his murderer shut the door,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not bear the knife myself. Besides, this Duncan</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath borne his faculties so meek, hath been</div>
                     <div class="line">So clear in his great office, that his virtues</div>
                     <div class="line">Will plead like angels, trumpet-tongued, against</div>
                     <div class="line">The deep damnation of his taking-off;</div>
                     <div class="line">And pity, like a naked new-born babe,</div>
                     <div class="line">Striding the blast, or heaven's cherubim, horsed</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the sightless couriers of the air,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall blow the horrid deed in every eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">That tears shall drown the wind. I have no spur</div>
                     <div class="line">To prick the sides of my intent, but only</div>
                     <div class="line">Vaulting ambition, which o'erleaps itself</div>
                     <div class="line">And falls on the other.</div>
                     <p>Enter LADY MACBETH</p>
                     <div class="line">How now! what news?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">He has almost supp'd: why have you left the chamber?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath he ask'd for me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">Know you not he has?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">We will proceed no further in this business:</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath honour'd me of late; and I have bought</div>
                     <div class="line">Golden opinions from all sorts of people,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which would be worn now in their newest gloss,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not cast aside so soon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">Was the hope drunk</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein you dress'd yourself? hath it slept since?</div>
                     <div class="line">And wakes it now, to look so green and pale</div>
                     <div class="line">At what it did so freely? From this time</div>
                     <div class="line">Such I account thy love. Art thou afeard</div>
                     <div class="line">To be the same in thine own act and valour</div>
                     <div class="line">As thou art in desire? Wouldst thou have that</div>
                     <div class="line">Which thou esteem'st the ornament of life,</div>
                     <div class="line">And live a coward in thine own esteem,</div>
                     <div class="line">Letting 'I dare not' wait upon 'I would,'</div>
                     <div class="line">Like the poor cat i' the adage?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">Prithee, peace:</div>
                     <div class="line">I dare do all that may become a man;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who dares do more is none.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">What beast was't, then,</div>
                     <div class="line">That made you break this enterprise to me?</div>
                     <div class="line">When you durst do it, then you were a man;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, to be more than what you were, you would</div>
                     <div class="line">Be so much more the man. Nor time nor place</div>
                     <div class="line">Did then adhere, and yet you would make both:</div>
                     <div class="line">They have made themselves, and that their fitness now</div>
                     <div class="line">Does unmake you. I have given suck, and know</div>
                     <div class="line">How tender 'tis to love the babe that milks me:</div>
                     <div class="line">I would, while it was smiling in my face,</div>
                     <div class="line">Have pluck'd my nipple from his boneless gums,</div>
                     <div class="line">And dash'd the brains out, had I so sworn as you</div>
                     <div class="line">Have done to this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">If we should fail?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">We fail!</div>
                     <div class="line">But screw your courage to the sticking-place,</div>
                     <div class="line">And we'll not fail. When Duncan is asleep--</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereto the rather shall his day's hard journey</div>
                     <div class="line">Soundly invite him--his two chamberlains</div>
                     <div class="line">Will I with wine and wassail so convince</div>
                     <div class="line">That memory, the warder of the brain,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall be a fume, and the receipt of reason</div>
                     <div class="line">A limbeck only: when in swinish sleep</div>
                     <div class="line">Their drenched natures lie as in a death,</div>
                     <div class="line">What cannot you and I perform upon</div>
                     <div class="line">The unguarded Duncan? what not put upon</div>
                     <div class="line">His spongy officers, who shall bear the guilt</div>
                     <div class="line">Of our great quell?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">Bring forth men-children only;</div>
                     <div class="line">For thy undaunted mettle should compose</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing but males. Will it not be received,</div>
                     <div class="line">When we have mark'd with blood those sleepy two</div>
                     <div class="line">Of his own chamber and used their very daggers,</div>
                     <div class="line">That they have done't?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">Who dares receive it other,</div>
                     <div class="line">As we shall make our griefs and clamour roar</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon his death?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">I am settled, and bend up</div>
                     <div class="line">Each corporal agent to this terrible feat.</div>
                     <div class="line">Away, and mock the time with fairest show:</div>
                     <div class="line">False face must hide what the false heart doth know.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.4">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 2. ACT II</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  Court of Macbeth's castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE II.  The same.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.4">3. SCENE III.  The same.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.5">4. SCENE IV.  Outside Macbeth's castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Court of Macbeth's castle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter BANQUO, and FLEANCE bearing a torch before him</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BANQUO</div>
                     <div class="line">How goes the night, boy?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLEANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">The moon is down; I have not heard the clock.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BANQUO</div>
                     <div class="line">And she goes down at twelve.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FLEANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">I take't, 'tis later, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BANQUO</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold, take my sword. There's husbandry in heaven;</div>
                     <div class="line">Their candles are all out. Take thee that too.</div>
                     <div class="line">A heavy summons lies like lead upon me,</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet I would not sleep: merciful powers,</div>
                     <div class="line">Restrain in me the cursed thoughts that nature</div>
                     <div class="line">Gives way to in repose!</div>
                     <p>Enter MACBETH, and a Servant with a torch</p>
                     <div class="line">Give me my sword.</div>
                     <div class="line">Who's there?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
                     <div class="line">A friend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BANQUO</div>
                     <div class="line">What, sir, not yet at rest? The king's a-bed:</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath been in unusual pleasure, and</div>
                     <div class="line">Sent forth great largess to your offices.</div>
                     <div class="line">This diamond he greets your wife withal,</div>
                     <div class="line">By the name of most kind hostess; and shut up</div>
                     <div class="line">In measureless content.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MACBETH</div>
